trans-unit.source: Step 6: Configure the WCF Client to call Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Configure the WCF Client to call Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Configure the WCF Client
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Configure the WCF Client

trans-unit.source: This is the sixth of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>sb2</token> service and a client that calls the service.
trans-unit.target: This is the sixth of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>sb2</token> service and a client that calls the service.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of all seven tasks, see <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of all seven tasks, see <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create an App.config file for a basic client application that accesses the service created previously in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create an App.config file for a basic client application that accesses the service created previously in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This App.config file defines the contract, binding, and name of the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This App.config file defines the contract, binding, and name of the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The code used for these tasks is provided in the example following the procedure.
trans-unit.target: The code used for these tasks is provided in the example following the procedure.

trans-unit.source: Time to completion: 10 minutes
trans-unit.target: Time to completion: 10 minutes

trans-unit.source: To configure the client
trans-unit.target: To configure the client

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, in the client project, double-click <ui>App.config</ui> to open the file, which currently contains the following XML elements:
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, in the client project, double-click <ui>App.config</ui> to open the file, which currently contains the following XML elements:

trans-unit.source: Add an XML element to the App.config file for <codeInline>system.serviceModel</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Add an XML element to the App.config file for <codeInline>system.serviceModel</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: This element declares that your application uses <token>indigo2</token>-style endpoints.
trans-unit.target: This element declares that your application uses <token>indigo2</token>-style endpoints.

trans-unit.source: As stated previously, much of the configuration of a <token>sb2</token> application is identical to a <token>indigo2</token> application; the main difference is the location to which the configuration file points.
trans-unit.target: As stated previously, much of the configuration of a <token>sb2</token> application is identical to a <token>indigo2</token> application; the main difference is the location to which the configuration file points.

trans-unit.source: Within the <codeInline>system.serviceModel</codeInline> element, add a <codeInline>%%amp;lt;client%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element.
trans-unit.target: Within the <codeInline>system.serviceModel</codeInline> element, add a <codeInline>%%amp;lt;client%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element.

trans-unit.source: This step declares that you are defining a <token>indigo2</token>-style client application.
trans-unit.target: This step declares that you are defining a <token>indigo2</token>-style client application.

trans-unit.source: Within the <codeInline>client</codeInline> element, define the name, contract, and binding type for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Within the <codeInline>client</codeInline> element, define the name, contract, and binding type for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This step defines the name of the endpoint, the contract defined in the service, and the fact that the client application uses TCP to communicate with <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This step defines the name of the endpoint, the contract defined in the service, and the fact that the client application uses TCP to communicate with <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint name will be used in the next step, to link this endpoint configuration with the service URI.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint name will be used in the next step, to link this endpoint configuration with the service URI.

trans-unit.source: Directly after the <codeInline>%%amp;lt;client%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element, add the following binding extension:
trans-unit.target: Directly after the <codeInline>%%amp;lt;client%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element, add the following binding extension:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>File</ui>, then <ui>Save All</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>File</ui>, then <ui>Save All</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample shows the App.config file for the Echo client.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample shows the App.config file for the Echo client.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have configured the client application, proceed to <link xlink:href="5a579422-16ce-4a35-8253-4c7b476e3864" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 7: Implement an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> to implement the rest of the application.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have configured the client application, proceed to <link xlink:href="5a579422-16ce-4a35-8253-4c7b476e3864" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 7: Implement an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> to implement the rest of the application.
